snippet.title: Artists letter to PM, Rape survivor unable to join school & more |The Urban Debate with Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, 49 Artists have written a letter to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi on the recent crime over Lynching, crushing of decent & misuse of 'Jai Shree Ram' in the crime. As Chief Minister of West Bengal Mamata Banerjee supports the letter by saying anyone can write the Pm and ask for help and state do not blame any party for this. Should India have a hate crime law?
In another story, Andra Pradesh's big employment push, the Andra Pradesh assembly has passed a controversial bill as they introduced a quota system by reserving 75% of the jobs in the state for locals. The Chief Minister Y. S. Jaganmohan Reddy says this will boost employment in the state of Andra Pradesh. We ask- should Quota be allowed in the private sector?
In another story, Raped as a child, rejected by society. Almost 42% of the survivors unable to rejoin schools. Many reasons as the child can be affected mentally or financially due to which he may not join school back, as the study says only 15% got the compensation, 16% of families affected by expensive legal procedures and 11% families saw their income drop following the rape.
We ask- No country for child rape survivors? 
To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: Delhi fights pollution amid COVID; Is the national capital living hell for people?| The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the rising pollution in Delhi and the poor air quality amid COVID. As winters are approaching, poor air quality along with COVID is posing a serious threat to the citizens in the National Capital. Experts have warned that COVID cases may spike in winter. A daily rise of 15,000 cases could be seen. 

The data shared from the report by CEEW India shows the factors contributing to Delhi Pollution. Aam Aadmi Party's Capt. Shalini Singh questions about what has Delhi govt managed to do in the last one year? Various violations by construction sites and neighbouring states have been seen. Has the Delhi govt failed once again?

snippet.title: Rajasthan politics: Is the tape proof of spying or a sinister plot? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes through the surging political crisis in the State of Rajasthan. While all other States are battling the Coronavirus pandemic battle, Rajasthan, on the other hand, is busy saving its own government. The Congress vs Congress tussle witnessed a sensational twist after Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot made the shocking allegation on Sachin Pilot.

After the venomous comments made by the CM, it shows this is an internal war between the Congress members. When we demand CBI action, we're within our rights, why should Congress have problems?

Professor Ranjan Mahan says, ‘What Ashok Gehlot said today, reflects his frustration with the way he's being treated’.  Whereas Congress’ Pawan Khera says, ‘Senior leaders of BJP are openly heard talking about buying MLAs. Instead of worrying about this, they want to know if we've tapped their phone lines legally or illegally. This is an admission of guilt’.

WATCH!

snippet.title: How will India tackle the challenge of vaccinating a billion people? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today we take up the challenges of COVID-19 vaccination for a billion people. Adar Poonawalla, the Chief Executive Officer of the Serum Institute of India, which is conducting trials of the COVID-19 vaccine. Adar Poonawalla on Saturday raised questions regarding the country’s plan to produce and distribute shots against the coronavirus disease.

Adar Poonawalla stated that the government needs a budget of 80,000 crores and a plan to deliver the process of vaccinating a billion people.

Phase 3 trials of the vaccine have been developed by Oxford University and British pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca, the vaccine is underway in India as part of a production and testing deal with the Pune-based Serum Institute of India (SII). Adar Poonawalla tweeted over how the government of India has to manage a fund of 80,000 crores available, over the next one year. He further added that is what the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare needs to buy and distribute the vaccine to everyone in India. This is the next concerning the challenge we need to tackle. He asked the question because as a country, India needs to plan and guide the vaccine manufacturers both in India and overseas to service the needs of our country in terms of procurement and distribution.

Sujata Rao, Former Health Secretary says, By the time the COVID-19 vaccine really gets into the market, it is quite possible the caseload might reduce and we may be getting into herd immunity. In which case, the uptake of the vaccine by the people might be problematic,”.

snippet.title: Has the Fake-TRP Scandal of Republic TV exposed the worst secrets of Indian Media? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we talk about the Fake TRP Scam that has been exposed by the Mumbai Police. The Commissioner of Mumbai Police, Param Bir Singh, while briefing the media announced that a suspicious pattern was noticed in the viewership of certain channels.

While investigating, it was discovered that confidential data about the placement of barometers were given to these channels. The channels then bribed the households to watch their channels the entire day to jack up the TRPs which would then result in higher advertising revenues. 

Vinay Tewari, Managing Editor, Mirror Now, commented on the scandal. “We have seen multiple cases where channels have covered stories in a most irresponsible manner possible, by showing off numbers to back their claim. Now it seems, as the Mumbai Police are alleging, a lot of it is basis kind of fraud,” he said. 

Prahlad Kakar, Advertising Guru commented, “The reportage of most channels today is so loud, they have lost credibility. It’s become entertainment, & no longer news. Advertisers would supposedly want to advertise on whichever channel has most eyeballs and tamasha”. 

Anurag Batra, Chairman and Editor-In-Chief B World Online, and Exchange 4 Media group said, “Advertisers, brands and media agencies have to go beyond ratings. They have to look at quality of content, credibility and balance”.

#FakeTRPScandal #RepublicTV

snippet.title: Should university exams be held or cancelled amid COVID-19 pandemic? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, see the conversation on the UGC decision to hold final year university exams amid the COVID-19 pandemic. There has been a tussle between the governments of six states who have openly opposed the UGC's decision to not cancel the exams of the students. 

"If UGC wanted to be the apex body to set guidelines, they should've acted sooner. After state govts took the initiative to cancel exams, the UGC realised opposition states have stolen the march on them and made conducting exams compulsory,"  says Ruchi Gupta, National Students Union of India

There has been a massive outrage on the UGC notification as students, parents, and teachers express their concern about the safety of students. 

"It is inexplicable how all consultative processes have been done away with and the future of the students is being played with," says, Sourya Majumder, College Student

There have been several requests, petitions, and letters written to the HRD Ministry and the UGC to cancel the exams and promote students. 

Will it take stock of these demands? 

#StatesvsUGC

snippet.title: Why is malnutrition, obesity on the rise in India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, A study conducted by the National Family Health Survey has revealed that some states have shown an increase in the rise of malnutrition and obesity. The current National Family Health survey was conducted on 6.1 lakh sample households. It involves household-level interviews to collect information on population, health, family planning and nutrition-related indicators.

The Senior Research Fellow at International Food Policy Research Delhi Dr Purnima Menon says that We should be very concerned about this survey. Need to focus on states where there has been a rise of malnutrition and obesity cases. 

Watch!

snippet.title: Shared-auto gang attacks youth, Mumbai's killer potholes & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight, 

Story 1: Youth attacked & robbed in Thane

A 25-year-old man attacked in Thane near Mumbai. He was stabbed, robbed & thrown from a moving auto-rickshaw by the driver & 3 co-passengers. Victim's cousin, Alum Rai Khan speaks to Faye D'souza.

According to witnesses, the victim was taken to the hospital in an ice-cream van. Former IPS officer Aftab Ahmed Khan says at that point, where could they get an ambulance?

Story 2: Killer Potholes

If the government is brazen and confident enough to multiply traffic fines 10 times over, can we not expect better service when it comes to our roads? How many more lives will need to be lost? 

Story 3: Aarey petitions in Bombay High Court

#Aarey hearing adjourned till Wednesday. Petitioner invites Chief Justice to visit Aarey. Earlier in the day, the state govt assured the court that trees won't be axed till September 30th.

Watch for more details!

snippet.title: Government opposes plea filed in Delhi HC; Should India legalise same-sex marriage? The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla she explains the arguments made by the govt in the court for same-sex marriage and questions, should India legalise same-sex marriage? The government opposed the plea filed in Delhi High Court seeking recognition of same-sex marriage.

This is not about gay marriage, it is about consenting adults deciding to take their relationship to the next stage. This has far-reaching responses says Equal Rights Activist Harish Iyer. All that the govt had to tell the Supreme Court today is that 'yes we agree that a lot of changes will have to be made & let's do that'

Throughout India, we've many indigenous traditions which accommodate diverse LGBTQI community as part of traditions. What makes the Solicitor General think that this is a kind of anti-Hindu move?

#SameSexMarriage

snippet.title: Delhi's COVID-19 battle intensifies;Will winter season add to the existing crisis? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss if the winter season may add onto the Covid-19 challenge. The Centre for Disease Control and NITI Aayog has issued a warning to groups that are vulnerable who can be severely affected in the coming winters.
The pollution and smog in the northern parts of the country, especially Delhi may get massively affected according to Dr. Mahesh Chandra Misra, Former Director of AIIMS. To combat this he said, “People can use one thin cloth mask, and a mask on top of it. This will prevent them from pollution and Covid-19.” 
When asked whether the pollution or the cold temperatures will affect our respiratory problems more, Dr. Shashank Joshi, DEAN Indian College of Physicians, Lilavati Hospital and Member, Covid-19 Task Force, replied that its the people’s irresponsibility. He said, “The biggest challenge that we have is that as we are unlocking people are behaving irresponsibly.” He added that even though there has not been a relationship between cold and Covid-19, the same may not be true for India, since we are a tropical country.
#Covid-19 #CovidInIndia

snippet.title: Is India's COVID-19 race on right track? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla illustrates nine such stages that are needed to be crossed before COVID-19 vaccine reaches anyone of us. She also talks about the major challenges that are lying ahead of us afore the vaccine arrives

Expertises share their views on India’s race for COVID-19 vaccine and the relevancy of promise made by BJP, of distributing free vaccines if elected.

Former Health Secretary Sujata Rao ‘Given the economic condition, I doubt the govt will be able to provide everyone with a free vaccine. Also, the government will be able to give a generic guideline, the last mile will depend on states & the majority don't have the capacity to do that’

Prof. Sudhir Krishna from National Centre for Biological Sciences, on the other hands, says that ‘It is likely there are going to be huge regional differences across the country. A good analytical plan from early on would allow us to do fine tailoring of the whole process’.

Watch!

#COVIDVaccine #COVID19 #CoronavirusS

snippet.title: Trump asks to stop vote counting; Is he scared of losing or has another card left? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
In this episode of The Urban Debate, Tanvi Shukla discusses the result of the most-awaited elections, that is U.S Elections. While Donald Trump and Joe Biden have been in a close call with each other, with Biden leading in some states, Donald Trump has come out with a new move. Earlier in the day, Donald Trump tweeted asking to stop the count and then later tweeted again, stating that any vote that came in after election day will not be counted. Joe Biden's current vote count stands at 253, while Trump stands at 213. The counting continues but at a very slow pace.

Tanvi Shukla discusses the U.S Elections and what the results are likely to hold with her guests on the show. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanhar states that it's a battle that is really poised with heavy advantage to Joe Biden. Tanvi Shukla questions Seema Sirohi, that even in some of the swing states, Latinos have voted for Donald Trump. How can one explain the non-white support for Donald Trump?

snippet.title: Is there a need to revive the economy, does the government have a strategy for it? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes up the most important topic and one that has everyone’s eyes fixed to, that is the Economy. The Coronavirus pandemic which broke in the country in the month of March has engulfed everyone in its claw including the economy. The economy has taken the worst hit this year with GDP’s Q1 crushing down to -23.9%. But what does a negative GDP means to you? Does the government have a strategy to revive the economy? Is there a need for a fresh stimulus package? Has the government’s response to the economic crisis been appropriate?

Dr Ajay Dua, Former Commerce Secretary stated that while going forward, the government needs to shed its inhibitions and not merely talk of a Rs 20 trillion package. What we need now is for the government to not worry too much about its fiscal deficit.

Economist Ramakumar adds that when the lockdown began, the Indian economy was highly vulnerable, the lockdown which was informed by a poor strategy, wreaked havoc after March. Madan Sabnavis, another economist states because of the uncertainty you won’t be able to take any consumption decisions which is going to affect businesses. They will not be able to invest unless they see demand coming through.

snippet.title: 10 reasons why RBI is optimistic on economic revival | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Today the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) after holding it's bi-annual monetary policy review came out and gave an exhaustive briefing on what was discussed and what's its view is on the series of issues. 

The Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) newly-appointed Monetary Policy Committee (MPC), on Friday, voted unanimously to keep key rates unchanged. Despite keeping status quo on rates, RBI delivered a lot more especially to soothe the nervous bond markets. Benchmark 10 year yield eased to five-week low and cooled off around 8bps to 5.93% intraday. 

Prabir Jha People Advisory HR strategist and Founder & CEO Prabir Jha say that we will need to watch the second half of this fiscal to be able to see if this is something that will cut across sectors, scale, and companies that even have a global consumer base.

Watch!

snippet.title: Will compensation for homebuyers be a deterrent for errant builders? |The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate, Compensation for Homebuyers 

Three separate instances of three different cities with exactly the same problems. Flat owners who have bought their houses with hard-earned money now face a threat of losing their homes. In Kochi, the Supreme Court has ordered the demolition of 5 apartment complexes that are built on the coastal zones.
The fate of 80,000 homeowners in Bengaluru hangs in the balance as they have now been sent notice by the Karnataka power transmission company as the houses are close to high tension electric wires.

The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said that the demolition of flats on the coastal zone of Ernakulam’s Maradu must be completed in 138 days, as per the timeline provided by the Kerala government.SC bench comprising also directed the freezing of assets of builders and promoters who were involved in the construction of illegal buildings ON the coastal area of Ernakulam’s Maradu. 

Will compensation for homebuyers be a deterrent for errant builders?

snippet.title: Allopathy vs Ayurveda; should Ayush doctors be allowed to conduct surgeries? I The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the ever ragging war between Allopathy vs Ayurveda. The government has given a nod to Ayurveda practitioners to perform surgeries. To this Indian Medical Association (IMA) has said that the government is playing with the health of people. 

"This is not a fight between Allopathy & Ayurveda. We want Ayurveda to grow and progress. Our worry is 'mixopathy', the creation of hybrid doctors" added former national president of IMA, Dr. Ravi Wankhedkar. 

The decision to allow Ayurveda practitioners to perform surgery as crucial as heart transplant has stirred controversy amongst the community of doctors. Is it a justified move?

snippet.title: Chinese firm Zhenhua caught tracking India's data, Is it a concern? The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss China's Zhenhua dragnet. Over 10,000 Indians, including personalities from politics, business, judiciary, media, sportspersons, and even crime-accused are being tracked by a big data firm linked to the Chinese government. Cyber Security Expert Ritesh Bhatia explains what is the Chinese firm Zhenhua doing and if there should be any concern. 

He says that the Zhenhua collects massive documents and information about key personalities. Zhenhua also tracks digital footprints of these personalities, he further adds. Information library is created from various sources. It also has data on people and their relations with various institutions. Data collected by this firm can also be used to access the dark web and run multiple algorithms. 

Every govt does these kinds of practices, the issue is, we're ignoring it at a massive scale. Concern should be how they're able to acquire data. If they're acquiring it by buying it from Indian companies, that is important.

#ZhenhuaData

snippet.title: FDI in digital media restricted to 26%, Cap in funding to hurt the news business? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza, FDI norms for Digital India. On Wednesday, the government made a big announcement to boost the economy The centre said that it had relaxed several FDI (foreign direct investment) norms in retail and other big announcements. The government has allowed 26% cap on funding in Digital Media.
How will the centre regulate funding that goes into digital platforms & what happens to media agencies that have over 26% FDI funding already? Will this move make it easier for news agencies to register abroad?

Story No 2: Economic Slowdown & GDP Growth

The Indian economy grew 5% annually in the first quarter of FY2020, slowing from a 5.8% growth in the march, missing market expectations.
Consumption can only be maintained by reducing savings. So personal household savings have actually fallen from 23% of GDP in 2012 to 17% in 2018: Senior Economist, Santosh Mehrotra to Faye D'Souza

snippet.title: Will Congress respond to the allegations of diverting public funds in PMNRF? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, find out details of the corruption scandal that has rocked the nation from the time the UPA government was in power with the Congress as the head. Shocking donations were made from the PM National Relief Fund and several government ministries to the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation. 

For a party that has been asking for transparency from the Centre on the spending of the PM Cares Fund established to fight COVID, there is a lot to answer for. 

"Money was diverted for personal use&this needs to be investigated. It's not that we're saying something that we can't prove,” says, Dr Syed Zafar, BJP Spokesperson 

The Congress has responded to the allegations of corruption being levelled against it, rubbishing the claims. 

"Is it not bizarre that BJP govt is giving donations & funds to RSS & BJP affiliate. By that logic isn't that dubious? This is how NGOs are funded,” says, Supriya Shrinate, Congress Spokesperson 

As the India-China conflict shows no clear sign of de-escalation can India depend on the assistance of the US to tackle China diplomatically? 

U.S. Secretary of Department of State says that the U.S will ensure that it's postured appropriately to counter the Chinese Army.

What are the next possible steps for India? 

#CongressReliefFundLoot #IndiaChinaConflict

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Government announced ₹20 lakh crore stimulus package saying that it amounts to 10% of India's GDP. Now, many experts & Opposition is are questioning it.

Times Network's internal calculation shows the overall fiscal impact of these announcements is 1% of GDP.

RELIEF PACKAGE DECODED: The ₹3 lakh crore package has been announced for MSMEs. How much of that will actually translate into on-ground lending? says, HDFC Bank Chief Economist Abheek Barua.

snippet.title: Mumbai Police’s BIG disclosures on social media; Is the threat real? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about one of the most pertinent and persistent problems, especially in this day and age and that is social media, which has become a weapon, Uttar Pradesh police and government have claimed that the Hathras case is being used in order to bring disharmony in the state of Uttar Pradesh. Posters have been shared online, fake news and protests have been called, all with the help of social media. Similar is the case in Maharashtra in connection to the Sushant Singh Rajput case. After the AIIMS panel ruled out murder, Mumbai police has begun its operation to mull down the fake news that was maligning the image of the Mumbai Police.

The Maharashtra government has now come out and said that there was a larger conspiracy to defame the Mumbai Police and the government. The Mumbai police are probing nearly 80,000 social media accounts, belonging to people from different countries and are fake, as per Mumbai police. They further add that 80,000 fake social media handles were created around that story in order to discredit the Mumbai Police. localized.title: Mumbai Police’s BIG disclosures on social media; Is the threat real? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla talks about one of the most pertinent and persistent problems, especially in this day and age and that is social media, which has become a weapon, Uttar Pradesh police and government have claimed that the Hathras case is being used in order to bring disharmony in the state of Uttar Pradesh. Posters have been shared online, fake news and protests have been called, all with the help of social media. Similar is the case in Maharashtra in connection to the Sushant Singh Rajput case. After the AIIMS panel ruled out murder, Mumbai police has begun its operation to mull down the fake news that was maligning the image of the Mumbai Police.

The Maharashtra government has now come out and said that there was a larger conspiracy to defame the Mumbai Police and the government. The Mumbai police are probing nearly 80,000 social media accounts, belonging to people from different countries and are fake, as per Mumbai police. They further add that 80,000 fake social media handles were created around that story in order to discredit the Mumbai Police. The governments now repeatedly blame the social media for a coordinated large attempt to target the government.

snippet.title: Row over Assam's marriage law; It empowers women or breaches liberty? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Avni Raja discusses the new marriage law which can be passed by the Assam Government. The Assam government is currently mulling to bring in a law that will bring transparency in the institution of marriage. 
According to the new law, the couple who plans to get married will have to maintain complete transparency by disclosing their income, occupation, & religion to each other. Disclosure will be mandatory a month prior to the marriage.
State Ministers claim that this is a move to empower women and equality, however, the law has landed itself in a massive controversy as it might bring in unnecessary interference by the government and also might breach one’s right to liberty.
The new marriage law empowers women or breaches liberty?

snippet.title: Day 16 of Kisan Andolan: Will the standoff between farmers and centre end? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, today marks Day 16 of the ongoing farmer protests that have been witnessed at a global scale now, the standoff between the centre and farmers continues till today. As farmers intensify their stir, even more farmers from Punjab's Amritsar are moving to Delhi to join the protests. 'If the problem is limited to certain states, where the structures are different, can the state not come in and bring in the change in laws & give assurance?' Tanvi Shukla questions Chengal Reddy who is a farmer Activist. ‘If the government's intention is not bad, what is wrong in including MSP as part of the law? What is wrong with making MSP compulsory for the private sector? The intention of these FarmLaws is for the private players and ensure farmers become weak’, says Congress’ Rohan R. Gupta.

snippet.title: Bihar elections 2020 dates out; Will polls amid COVID impact political parties? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes up the Bihar elections topic and discusses how the elections will be held amidst the pandemic. Bihar is the first state which will be conducting elections amidst the pandemic and the Chief Election Commissioner has announced the dates and has also made it clear that the elections will be conducted in three phases. 

Will the COVID-19 norms make it more challenging to take the message to the voters of the work that the political party has done? Tanvi Shukla asks Syed Afzal Abbas of JDU party. Chitranjan Gagan states that the people of Bihar have made up their mind to get freedom from Nitish Kumar government. He further adds that Tejashwi Yadav will become the next Chief Minister of Bihar. Nitish Kumar has been the CM of the state for the last 15 years.  

Nikhil Anand adds that BJP is happy that elections are a part of the democratic process and it should take place on time. BJP is surprised that RJD wants to come to power on a hollow note. We are sure we will come to power, adds Nikhil Anand.

snippet.title: Rising attacks on women for saying NO;  Is India no country for women? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we live in a world that has questioned women over every little choice that has been made. Women have been told to behave a certain way, dress a certain way, and talk in a certain way only to be safe in a place. We, as a society have still not constructed a safe space for women. What lies ahead is the trauma faces by these women due to patriarchy. Men still do not understand that NO means NO. There is no value given to something like consent and if a woman wants to do something. Acid attack is one such criminal, brutal, and gun wrenching crime that is committed in India because a woman does not consent to a man’s wish. A man shot at point-blank, stalked, and harassed, and made completely uncomfortable with everybody around her body. Tanvi Shukla shares the details of such instances that are growing in our society and what a woman goes through. These gut-wrenching details bring light upon factors that cause rapes, a rapist. The dangerous part is that because of such growing instances, many young girls would be scared to say No, just because of the fear and consequences. What can we as a society do about it?

snippet.title: Sudden rise in Corona cases; Spike due to cold, pollution or bad governance? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the COVID-19 outbreak which is haunting the National Capital. The spike, day by day, is only becoming worrisome. Delhi reported 5739 cases in the last 24 hours.

While, Delhi Health Minister has cited aggressive contact tracing and testing as the reason for the steep surge, Delhi Governor, on the other hand, approved government’s proposal to raise a number of passengers in buses from 20 to full seating capacity amid the surge.

But, what's the key reason for this sudden spike in COVID-19 cases? What should our priority be right now? What can the central Government do help the people of Delhi?

Sharing her views on this, Aam Aadmi Party’s Reena Gupta says ‘With cold weather setting in & worsening air pollution, a spike was expected. It is being monitored at the highest level and we're very well equipped & prepared if in case the number of cases rises’.

Medical Director, LNJP Medical Director Dr Suresh Kumar cites a different reason for the spike, says ‘Air Pollution is one of the reasons but, more importantly, the behaviour of people is what needs to change. Young people are still very careless, gathering in crowds and in return carrying the virus back to family and friends’

Watch!

#COVID19 #DelhiCovidOutbreak #DelhiCoronavirus

snippet.title: Will the new ordinance announced by central government help curb Delhi pollution? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the new law announced by the central government to tackle pollution in the Delhi-NCR region. 

Year after year Delhi chokes as pollution keeps on increasing. To curb this pollution, the central government has announced the formation of a high powered commission with 20 permanent members which will look at the issue of air quality management in the national capital region. 

The new law imposes a penalty for violators which goes up to one crore rupees as a fine and also a jail term of up to five years depending on the violation. The law will be effective immediately and will look into stubble burning, dust pollution, and other pollution problems prevalent in the region.

Reena Gupta from Aam Aadmi Party states that she does not see anything new in this particular ordinance. She further states that they already had EPCA with the powers that have been promised in this commission. But, she continues that, EPCA did not use its powers because there is no political will to actually do anything.

#DelhiPollution #DelhiAirPollution

localized.title: Will the new ordinance announced by central government help curb Delhi pollution? | The Urban Debate
localized.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the new law announced by the central government to tackle pollution in the Delhi-NCR region. 

Year after year Delhi chokes as pollution keeps on increasing. To curb this pollution, the central government has announced the formation of a high powered commission with 20 permanent members which will look at the issue of air quality management in the national capital region. 

The new law imposes a penalty for violators which goes up to one crore rupees as a fine and also a jail term of up to five years depending on the violation. The law will be effective immediately and will look into stubble burning, dust pollution, and other pollution problems prevalent in the region.

Reena Gupta from Aam Aadmi Party states that she does not see anything new in this particular ordinance. She further states that they already had EPCA with the powers that have been promised in this commission. But, she continues that, EPCA did not use its powers because there is no political will to actually do anything.

#DelhiPollution #DelhiAirPollution

snippet.title: In-depth details of India-China meet, Are they staring at a prolonged standoff? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the high-level meeting of the commanders of India and China. The talks started yesterday and lasted for about 12 hours. A joint statement may be issued by India-China. Are we looking a prolonged standoff and there can be a breakthrough? 

Chinese have to demonstrate that they mean each & every line that is being spoken. They're the ones who have broken the confidence, says Lt Gen PJS Pannu (Retd), Former Deputy Chief IDS & Former Commander 14 Corps on the joint statement issued by India & China. 

Chinese intrusions reflect the events leading up to the 1962 conflict & up to Kargil. One should brace themselves to deal with the new China which will include both territorial aggression & cyber attacks says Maroof Raza, Strategic Affairs Expert. The month of October is crucial as many talks will be taking place. 

#IndiaChinaStandoff

snippet.title: Why is caste-bullying still prevalent in elite institutions? | The Urban Debate Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Faye D'Souza, there have been several cases where the people are being targeted and driven to suicide for belonging to the lower strata of society. A second-year student of Gynaecology and Obstetrics department, 27-year-old Payal Tadvi was found hanging in her room.
The kin of a junior doctor in Mumbai alleged that her seniors drove her to suicide by constantly ragging her, several doctors have staged protests in solidarity with the deceased. The family claimed that the deceased was bullied by her seniors for belonging to a lower caste.
Should quota details in the admission list be kept confidential?
Why is caste-bullying still prevalent in elite institutions?

snippet.title: Is India's COVID-19 success story a fallacy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla today, the COVID testing rate that has been a basis of comparison with countries that have noticed a spike in COVID cases was being discussed. Prime Minister Narendra Modi today met Chief Ministers to discuss the way forward. Tanvi Shuka shares the data on India's testing rate and questions, why is India still unable to ramp up its testing rate?

We cannot compare the situation of India with European countries, the number of testing has to be matched with many other things like contact tracing and isolation, explains Dr. Anant Mohan, Professor and Head of Department of Pulmonary, Critical Care, AIIMS, he further adds, all the factors together make an impact.

Dr. Arokiaswamy Velumany, Chairman and MD, Thryocare Technologies Ltd explains that the basis India is conducting the testing, we should know the numbers that we are targeting. 

Dr. Suneela Garg says that the government has to strengthen the containment strategy, she also says that we as a country need to create awareness, remove the stigma that exists which ends up discriminating against other people and focus upon managing strategy.

snippet.title: Can Muralitharan, Vijay Sethupathi be blamed for giving up artistic freedom? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss Vijay Sethupathi’s decision of backing off from Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic ‘800’. 

The recent controversy that sparked over Muttiah Muralitharan’s biopic 800 has now resulted in the actor backing off from the project. Before quitting, the actor had tweeted that he will not be backing off from the film but when Muttiah Muralitharan, himself, requested the actor to quit for his career’s sake, Vijay Sethupathi replied ‘vanakam’. 

The trolls have successfully butchered artistic freedom by severely criticising a great Sri Lankan cricketer and Tamilian actor. 

The backlash originated from people reflecting on Muttiah Muralitharan’s views on the 2009 genocide against Tamilians. To this Narayan Lakshman, Associate Editor of The Hindu, has questioned, "Are the same people objecting to Vijay Sethupathi playing this role, demanding that internally displaced Tamils in Sri Lanka be rehabilitated? Are you so dedicated to the cause or are you picking this because he's an easy target?”

Film Producer, Dr. G. Dhananjayan has stated that the main issue lies in the fact that a popular actor is seen as playing and endorsing Muttiah Muralitharan, a person considered to be anti-Tamil or betrayer of the cause.

snippet.title: Do the results confirm the perception that Congress is a liability in alliances? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, NDA’s historic win with 125 seats in alliance with BJP. Mahagathbandhan has been reduced to 110 sears and AIMIM and JLP have made huge dents when it comes to the prospects of JD(U). The elections have proved that the public of Bihar wanted to vote for development and empowerment. Congress’ defeat has now stirred new controversies when it comes to elections, new organisational changes are expected from the party considering how strong the ruling party is, the opposition has to bring a new change in the system. From crediting women voters for BJP’s victory in Bihar Elections 2020 to reaffirming the support to Nitish Kumar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi delivered a victory address at the BJP headquarters and thanked every single voter who made BJP what it is. Tanvi Shukla and Mirror Now’s Managing Editor Vinay Tiwari discuss the key takeaways from Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s address at the BJP headquarters.

snippet.title: What Democrats win means to India? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, The change at the helm of the United States is likely to have profound implications domestically, of course, but will also have a significant bearing on the Indian economy. A more pragmatic approach to bilateral trade and increases in domestic healthcare spending could see the Indian economy benefit significantly from a Joe Biden presidency. There is also likely to be a strategic shift in India-US relations as they relate to trade. The United States is among the few countries that India enjoys a current account surplus with i.e. India exports more to the United States than it imports from it. What does Joe Biden's win mean for India?

#USElectionResults2020

snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla,

Story 1 Online Child Sexual Abuse

In the past one year, 15,190 complaints of online child sexual abuse were received by the govt but only 31 http://F.I.Rs  were registered and the CBI has now set up an anti-child abuse unit.
Is the govt portal only for perception, not action?

We must ensure that all cases of online child sexual abuse be investigated & inquired into by people who are technically sound & who have been imparted with such training: Advocate Ashish Kumar

snippet.description:

Doctors Strike has been called off but we have to solve the problem from its absolute root. Only when our public healthcare system becomes stronger, will the private healthcare system won't be able to run riot over what it does.

snippet.title: Don't citizens deserve to know who is funding political parties?| The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On the debate tonight, we will talk about politics and how parties manage to pull of rallies and give away so many things to voters during election season.
During election season, every political party giveaways stuff to attract voters, but from where do they get this money?
Shouldn't we know about this link of who is sponsoring political parties?
Laws around funding to political parties have been relaxed. We demand that information about donations to political parties be made public. Political parties are made subject to RTI so that as voters, we know where the money is coming from.
Whose money is being funnelled back into India for political funding?
If someone funds a political party heavily, does it encourage crony capitalism? Don't you as a citizen deserve to know where the money is coming from?
Do Electoral Bonds increase the thickness of the veil on political funding?
Listen in!

snippet.title: Govt data reveals 165% jump in sedition cases, Is the clause being misused? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Sahar Zaman, we discuss the rise in sedition cases in the past 3 years and its misuse. The sedition law is Section 124 of the IPC. The NCRB figures show a 165% jump in the sedition cases in India. Is the government misusing the sedition clause? Should we continue having this law? Why shouldn't this law be scrapped? Which govt will have the political will to scrap the law? 

Change in society comes through dissent and disagreements. Every right-thinking person must oppose the govt whenever there is an opportunity to do that says Former Chief Information Commissioner, Shailesh Gandhi. For the govt, dissent is sedition. UAPA is being put on anybody & everybody says Congress', Shama Mohamed.
Watch!

#SeditionLaw

snippet.title: Midday meal Controversy, Shouldn't authorities ground A320 Neo? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Mid-day Meal Controversy

Months after Mirror Now exposed how food packets infested with insects, worms & ants were supplied to schools as part of mid-day meal scheme in Bengaluru, authorities swing into action. Lab test results reveal items substandard & unsafe.

Story No 2: VVIP Racism in Karnataka 

Karnataka CM BS Yediyurappa's nephew threatens Deputy Commissioner of transfer after he was not allowed to enter a temple due to security reasons.

Story No 3: Missing UP student

5 days since law student from Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur went missing police yet to question BJP leader #Chinmayanand who was accused by the girl for harassing & threatening her. The police have now been accused of maligning the girl's character.

Story No 4: Discrimination in UP school

Dalit students in Uttar Pradesh allege discrimination during mid-day meals. They allegedly carry their own utensils. Some Dalit students claim that other students don't want to sit next to them. Meanwhile, school authorities have defended themselves.
Is this systemic? Are the schools pushing this further into another generation?

Story No 5: DGCA's statement reveals 40% of A320 Neo passenger planes in India run on Pratt & Whitney engines which have reported multiple snags in recent past. 

Shouldn't the aviation authority ground these planes? Is our safety being compromised? 

Watch to know more!

snippet.title: Lok Sabha passes the Essential Commodities Bill, Are ordinances anti-farmer? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss, the farmer ordinance bill proposed in the Parliament and the protests thereafter. Lok Sabha has now passed the contentious Essential Commodities, Bill. Why are farmers protesting the ordinances? Are the ordinances anti-farmer?

The farmers have protested in Punjab, Haryana and North-Eastern States. According to them, their requests have not been considered. This bill will impact their Minimum Support Price (MSP) privilege. Rakesh Tikait of Bharatiya Kisan Union says the private mandis will shut down after 2 years on which tax has to be paid. The farmers stocking capacity is also an issue which is not addressed in the bill. This is objectionable.  

As per the 7th schedule of the Constitution, the agriculture & Mandis are state subject.  The promulgation of an ordinance of GOI without taking into consideration the State is questionable says Professor Gourav Vallabh of Congress.

#FarmersProtest #EssentialCommoditiesBill

snippet.title: W.H.O recognizes COVID is airborne, Should we take more precautions? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, WHO recognizes evidence that COVID 19 is airborne. Should you take more precautions? 

Dr. Rajesh M. Parikh, Director, Medical Research Jaslok Hospital explains.

Lilavati Hospital's Dr. Shashank Joshi says "The risk of airborne transmission goes up to where there is crowded, clustered & poorly ventilated environment; humidity is going to make it worse
Listen in to know some precautions Mumbaikars can take to keep safe.

Dr. Subramanian Swaminathan Sr Consultant at Infectious diseases Gleneagles Global says "We need to be very careful as it has huge public health & infection control implications. Once we say it's airborne, we have to invest in negative pressure rooms for everybody, that's not a possibility."

Saurabh Arora, Founder & CEO - University Living explains after POTUS Donald Trump modifies student visa, what impact will it have on Indian students in the U.S? 

CEO CanAm Asia Jeff Decicco says "What will probably happen over the next few weeks is that some of the universities will start to reconsider the policies, as they are also a business after all."

snippet.title: MP's crass politics continues, Will political parties penalise Sexist Netas? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the never-changing sexism plaguing the Indian politics. 

Kamal Nath, former Chief Minister of Madhya Pradesh, recently called his former cabinet colleague Imarti Devi as ‘an item’. Furthermore, he has refused to apologise for the same, claiming that he never meant to offend anyone and ‘item’ is not even a derogatory word. 

On the other hand, a BJP Minister, Bisahulal Singh has questioned Vishwanath Singh’s first wife whereabouts, while calling his second wife a mistress. 

BJP to condemn Kamal Nath on his comment held protests and wore masks made out of his face while dancing like item girls, sporting lehengas. This idea of protest is yet another insult to women all over. 

When questioned the validity of this protest, Charu Pragya from BJP said, “Kamal Nath justified the word ‘item.’ My party workers were trying to show how offensive that word is.” 

Advocate Trisha Shetty, says that we need to focus on shaming the sexist politicians publicly and asking political parties what punitive action is being taken. She further states if someone made such a remark on a male politician, there would definitely be violence.

#SexismInPolitics #KamalNath

snippet.title: Fake TRP scam busted by Mumbai Police, Viewers & advertisers cheated? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Fake Television Rating Point (TRP) busted by the Mumbai Police. 4 people have been arrested and a news briefing that was held by the Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh. 3 channels, Box Cinema, Fakth Marathi, and Republic TV which is run by Arnab Goswami were named by the Mumbai Police Commissioner. 

exchange4media Group and BWorldOnline  Chairman & Editor in Chief Anurag Batra say that Advertisers, brands and media agencies have to go beyond ratings. They have to look at the quality of content, credibility and balance. 

In a view, Mirror Now Managing Editor Vinay Tewari says, “It is important for quality to be considered. It cannot be a numbers game. This has lowered the level of discourse and information that is supposed to be supplied by us honourably and with integrity.”

#RepublicFarziRatings #FakeTRP #TRPFraud #ParambirSingh #RepublicTRPFraud

snippet.title: Ramdev's Ayurveda treatment: Modern medicines biased against traditional cure? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Patanjali claiming to launch COVID-19 medicine was discussed. The debate over the COVID drug is now taking the Ayurveda versus Allopathy turn, where Ramdev expressed his concern over the bias and prejudice against Ayurveda. 

The ongoing question pertaining to modern medicine being biased towards a traditional cure is being talked about. 

Dr. Sukumar Sadeshmukh of Ayurvedgram says that there exists defamation towards Ayurveda from the modern fraternity. When a patient comes to an Ayurvedic doctor and suggests to take a COVID test, he is not allowed to.

There is no cure for COVID-19 in any 'pathy'. Since, Ayurveda is considered apathy with well-known remedies which intern help in boosting the immune, says, Dr. Asmita Wele, Professor at College of Ayurved, Bhartiya Vidyapeeth.

Dr. Sumaiya Shaikh, a Neuroscientist, explains how Ayurveda has gone back and forth between immunity-boosting and the ongoing COVID-19 treatment. She also mentions how there exists nothing that can boost your immunity in an innate way through herbal cure.
Watch!

snippet.title: Delhi's Sero Survey results out, what should be the next strategy? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla discusses the much talked Sero Survey that was conducted in the National Capital. The Sero Survey was held to estimate the spread of Coronavirus. The Delhi Government has released the reports on public domain today and the results are quite alarming. One out of four people in Delhi has been affected with COVID-19.

How relevant is the survey? Should we be concerned? How should policies change basis Sero Survey results?

AAP’s Akshay Marathe says, ‘We are not taking any decisions based on this survey. We will not, at this point, be in a position to change or evolve our strategy based on the results of sero survey’.

Whereas, Former Professor & Head, Centre for Community Medicine, AIIMS Delhi, Dr Chandrakant Pandav says,’ If the methodology is not right, the results don't mean anything. There is a lot of missing information here’.

Watch!

snippet.description:

Lambasting the Uttar Pradesh police, the top court ordered the release of journalist Prashant Kanojia immediately who was jailed for a tweet against the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. While allowing the probe on defamation to continue, the court asked why he was arrested when he did not commit murder.

snippet.title: Should schools help teachers understand gender diversity? | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:

snippet.title: Ktaka govt delaying trust vote, Flood wreaks havoc in Bihar | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza, tonight, Big twist to Karnataka conundrum as a further delay is done by the Congress MLAs. A meet took place between a BJP delegation and the speaker but still the outcome is questioned for today. The speaker declared the trust vote will take place on 22nd July but the Congress MLAs are not leaving their ground. The congress politicians want clarity from the speaker's side if the whip applies or not as they were ready for trust vote on these criteria. Meetings after meeting are taking between the politicians. Why is Congress-JDS delaying the trust vote? 
In the second story, The Nitish Kumar government is exposed as they are not able to help the people affected by floods, already 102 people have lost their lives in the flood, many people are without drinking water, food & place to live. After so many days the state government took the stock of the situation. There are about 133 relief camps in 3 districts who are providing aid to the people. The Assam government was much better than that of the Bihar as the evacuated the people from the endangered places were as in Bihar no precaution was taken as now 12 districts are affected by the floods.
To know more watch the video!

snippet.title: Is it safe for states to hold exams amid a pandemic or should they be cancelled? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, find out if the decision to conduct board exams by states like Karnataka will hurt the students in the middle of a pandemic. The cases of COVID-19 are surging across the country bringing up the question, can the government ensure that the safety of the students will not be compromised? 

“We do understand the government has done a lot to get this going, but I don't think anybody in this world can right now guarantee 100% safety,” says Srinivas, President, Managements of Independent CBSE School Association

Parents across the nation have expressed concern and anxiety as they grapple with the twin fear of Coronavirus pandemic and the future of their children. Who will bear the onus of this dilemma and is the country prepared to deal with the crisis. 

“The environment is anxious at home. The examination has taken up a different outlook altogether. It is not an exam, it’s like they're going for a war,” says, Kajal Roy, Parent

Board exams in India have always been high-pressure situations that have given students and parents sleepless nights but is this double dilemma of a pandemic going to be the breaking point? 

#BoardExamsSuspense 

Watch to know more!

snippet.title: Delhi Govt predicts COVID cases till July, A fear-mongering or impending crisis? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, the health status of the Coronavirus pandemic in Delhi is discussed. The Delhi government has projected that the National Capital may have 5.5 lakh COVID-19 cases by the end of July and 80,000 beds will be needed to treat the patients infected.

Akshay Marathe from Aam Aadmi Party talks about the estimation is projected by the end of July and the numbers are put out so there's consensus on whether to determine if community transmission exists. He later talks about the factors that are taken into consideration to determine this estimation.

The Chairman of IMA Hospital, Dr. V K Monga admits that there is an extensive rate of community transmission in Delhi and Mumbai which has led to higher COVID-19 cases.

Dr. Devinder Singh Rana, Chairman, Sir Ganga Ram Hospital also explains how fear of rising COVID-19 cases should be a concern for the Delhi govt and the central govt to start constructing COVID dedicated hospitals. Watch the video to know more!

snippet.title: FB 'Insider's' sensational disclosure, Fake accounts used to influence elections? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On the Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, we discuss the charges against Facebook. Insider exposes Facebook say they let fake accounts influence elections. The uses & abuse of social media platforms are also highlighted. Buzzfeed brought to us a story of a whistle-blower, Sophie Zhang, an ex-employee from Facebook who in her memo explained how governments, political parties, used Facebook to influence voters & elections. 

Media Editor Craig Silverman says the whistle-blower came across repeated examples of cases whereof Govts & heads of states being linked to the network of fake accounts, that would harass opposition figures through comments, amplify false information or propaganda. The insider's claims are linked to Delhi elections. A network was used to politically affect the elections. 

Facebook doesn't have the capacity because it hasn't invested enough in addressing hate speech, co-ordinated attacks, political interference. It needs to be regulated because it is a significant company here, says Nikhil Pahwa, Founder of MediaNama.com.

snippet.title: Will IPL 2020 minus spectators lose its dazzle? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla takes you through a new topic of discussion amid lockdown. The sports field has been badly hit by the Coronavirus pandemic across the globe, however, ideas of reopening various sports are mulling around the corner. Should the games begin? How will the match be held in an empty stadium? 
‘Travelling is our biggest challenge. You've got to look at Sports as an economic activity' if you've opened up other industries then I don't see why the sports industry, with all precautions, be opened as well’ says Former Indian International Cricketer Deep Dasgupta.
Whereas, Kartik Murali says, ‘I know that everybody wants a bit of normalcy but, it's tough and unfortunately we have the curve flattened to be able to have an event of this magnitude, you need to be extremely brave to take that call’.
Watch!

snippet.title: Caste case in Madras, PM Modi's strong stand on Kashmir & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'Souza,

Story No 1: Karnataka Cabinet Expansion 

Almost a month after BS Yediyurappa was sworn in & a week after cabinet formation, allocation of portfolios still pending. As a result, citizens' issues have been ignored. Where's the service to the people?
Why have 3 Deputy CMs been appointed for Karnataka? What work will this govt take up immediately? What are the priorities for the cabinet? 

Story No 2: Caste discrimination case in Madras HC
Madras HC expresses displeasure over separate crematoriums for Dalits while hearing a caste discrimination case where a group of Dalits was forced to lower a body from a bridge as they were denied road access to the crematorium.

Story No 3: PM Modi-US Pres Trump bilateral meet

 Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent a strong message on Kashmir when meeting with U.S President Donald Trump on the sidelines of the G7 summit in France. PM Modi said Kashmir is a bilateral issue & both India & Pakistan are capable of handling it & working towards a solution.

snippet.title: Sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in India, was Unlock implemented too early? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, As the COVID cases are on a rise in the interior areas, districts that barely had any cases, in states which had a very low number. The question of whether Unlock in India was implemented too early is being discussed. 

Priyam Manisha, Political Analyst speaks to Tanvi Shukla on how Bihar has only a handful of people who can manage the COVID-19  situation on the ground. She also mentions that the primary healthcare centre does not exist in Bihar. It is now in a situation of collapse. 

Anant Bhan, Researcher, Global Health, Bioethics, and Health Policy explains how lockdowns might be useful as a temporary platform to allow you to prepare, but it will not help in averting the spread of infection. The sooner people realize that it is better. He also says that the country cannot go on in the lockdown mode.

snippet.title: Kulbhushan Jadhav case, Protest to save Aarey & more | The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate With Faye D'souza tonight,

Story 1: #KulbhushanJadhav

The Pakistan government has issued an official statement on Kulbhushan Jadhav's consular access. Says, we provided uninterrupted access and in order to ensure transparency, the access was recorded. Mirror Now's Faye D'souza & Meenakshi with the details.

Story 2: MIRROR NOW CAMPAIGN #SaveAarey

MIRROR NOW CAMPAIGN to Save Aarey powered by citizens & activists across Mumbai & India gains steam. Through the weekend, Mumbaikars stood as one to fight the cutting of 2700 trees. Bollywood stars also lend support to the people's movement.

snippet.title: UAPA law failed to prosecute or not used right? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate with Tanvi Shukla, Interesting data was shared in a Parliament by the government regarding the "Anti-terror law", The UAPA law. The "Anti-terror law" was amended last year. These changes were brought in to counter the terrorism and it will help the agencies further. but in the last 2 years, 3,005 cases have been filed and only 821 charge sheets. Is Centre's data indicative that anti-terror law is being misused?

Delhi Former Commissioner of Police TR Kakkar says "When cases of this nature occur, first thing is to bring around peace & for that, you register these cases if you've proof. When you say 3,000 cases filed, it doesn't mean those cases have been closed."

#AntiTerrorLaw

snippet.title: Ram Temple promise fulfilled; is majority politics now an all-party trend? | The Urban Debate
snippet.description:
On The Urban Debate today, Tanvi Shukla demonstrates the grand Bhoomi Pujan celebration at Ayodhya’s Ram Mandir. The BJP and its politics amid the 80s -90s revolved around the Babri Masjid and Ram Mandir controversy. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other BJP leaders displayed their unapologetic faith towards Lord Shri Ram.

Is this a change in politics that every party is looking at? Was it necessary to hold this grand event amid Coronavirus crisis?

BJP’s Shweta Shalini says, ‘We know that we came into power second time only because if the development work that the BJP has done. Prime Minister Narendra Modu is known to fulfil all his promises & this is another feather in his cap.’

While, Binoy Viswam, Rajya Sabha MP (CPI) says, ‘BJP very cunningly tried to use legion under people's faith for their very narrow and anti-people political ends. There are thousands of people dying due to COVID-19 pandemic & the priority should be to fight it & help those in need’.

WATCH!
